FacilityStr1: 2821 Waha Rd, Past Waha Gas Plant
FacilityStr2: entry, 1st left onto rd, go 0.5 mi

_prev_prog_3.EquipmentTested: Inspected & tested burner management system on Hot Glycol Heater
_prev_prog_3.Description:
Barilla Draw Slug Catcher Facility is located just south and west of Energy Transfer Partner's ("ETP's") Waha Gas Plant in Pecos County, Texas.  There is no physical address for the Barilla Draw Slug Catcher Facility.  The address of ETP's Waha Gas Plant is 2821 Waha Road, Coyanosa, TX 79730.  From Farm to Market Road ("FM") 1450, go 0.5 mile south on FM 1776, then 1 mile west on Waha Road to arrive at the main entrance to the Waha Gas Plant.  To reach the Barilla Draw Slug Catcher Facility, drive west past the main entrance to the Waha Gas Plant on Waha Road.  Take the first left onto the private lease road just west of the Waha Gas Plant. Go 0.5 miles south to the gate into the Barilla Draw Slug Catcher Facility.



The primary business of the Barilla Draw Slug Catcher Facility is bulk liquid storage and distribution of crude petroleum and petroleum products, including liquefied petroleum gas (NAICS 42471).  When the Centurion Pipeline L.P. (Occidental Petroleum Corporation) natural gas pipeline entering the Barilla Draw Slug Catcher Facility is being pigged to remove condensed liquid slugs, the equipment installed at the site is designed to safely separate and stabilize those liquids. A heated stabilizer column drives off remaining gas vapors ("light ends") from the pipeline liquids.  The present rated capacity of the Barilla Draw Slug Catcher Facility is 4,000 barrels (168,000 gallons) of stabilized condensate.



The facility has developed a risk management program to address the EPA RMP requirements (40 CFR Part 68).  Barilla Draw Slug Catcher Facility is diligent in the handling of all chemicals and is dedicated to the safety of its employees and the neighboring community.  The Barilla Draw Slug Catcher Facility staff is trained and utilizes equipment to monitor the facility and provide safeguards, while effectively and safely processing and storing the covered chemical, propane & butane. 



ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION POLICIES



Barilla Draw Slug Catcher Facility has a long standing commitment to worker and public safety. This commitment is demonstrated by the resources invested in accident prevention, such as personnel training and consideration of safety in the design, operation, and maintenance of the covered process.  Barilla Draw Slug Catcher Facility's policy is to implement reasonable controls to prevent foreseeable releases of regulated substances.



STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCE



Barilla Draw Slug Catcher Facility handles intermittent pipeline liquid slugs (heavier hydrocarbons that have condensed from the pressurized natural gas in a pipeline).  Thus, there are hazardous substances (flammable liquids) that are utilized in or generated by the process.

 

Based on the EPA definitions of flammable hydrocarbons, the quantities of the regulated flammable mixture in processing areas as well as in storage tanks at the facility consists of a total of approximately 785,000 lbs. of the flammable mixture.  The facility has designated this bulk liquid handling, storage & distribution activity as one Covered Process described below.

 

Bulk Petroleum Product Storage & Distribution (Stabilized Condensate/LPG)

The Barilla Draw Facility safely separates liquid slugs that enter the site from a buried natural gas pipeline.  The separated pipeline liquids are routed to a heated stabilizer column where any remaining gas vapors ("light ends") are driven off, compressed and returned to the pipeline.  The stabilized condensate (hydrocarbon liquids) are routed to horizontal bullet storage tanks.  The bulk liquids are loaded into tank trucks for transport to refineries/fractionation plants or blending terminals.  Personnel from the Operator, Kinder Morgan Treating, are present at all times during the day when truck loading operations are underway in the Barilla Draw Facility.

ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS



As part of the implementation of this Risk Management Program, key Prevention Program elements were implemented by Barilla Draw Slug Catcher Facility to manage process safety issues associated with the covered process.  In addition, common industry standards, policies, and procedures are currently utilized to ensure safe practices are being performed.

Barilla Draw Slug Catcher Facility's EPA RMP Prevention Program 3 elements for the flammable substance, propane/butane mixtures, include:

?Process Safety Information

?Process Hazard Analysis

?Operating Procedures

?Training

?Mechanical Integrity

?Management of Change

?Pre-Startup Safety Review

?Compliance Audits

?Incident Investigation

?Employee Participation

?How Work Permit

?Contractors

?Emergency Planning & Response

?Injury and Illness Prevention Program



FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY



Prior to the delivery date of this document, there have been no EPA RMP related accidents at the Barilla Draw Slug Catcher Facility in the past five (5) years as this is a new facility.  An incident investigation procedure is kept onsite which summarizes the required data to be reported, and will be utilized, as necessary to document any EPA RMP related incidents.



PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY



The planned changes to improve safety at the Barilla Draw Slug Catcher Facility resolve the recommendations derived from the Process Hazard Analysis, as well as incorporate recommendations from Compliance Audits and Incident Investigations, as they become available.  The Barilla Draw Slug Catcher Facility has employed a tracking system for implementing these recommendations and ensuring their closure.  As required by the regulations, recommendations will be addressed and closed in a timely manner. 



EXTERNAL EVENTS ASSESSMENT



During the PHA for each system, a broad list of external events and human factors was considered by the Team.  General events external to the plant that can conceivably cause a release of stabilized or unstabilized condensate were evaluated.  The External Events that were considered credible include, but are not limited to, earthquake, tornado, vandalism, sabotage, external fire, human error/misoperation, and vehicle impact.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY



Barilla Draw Slug Catcher Facility is located just south and west of Energy Transfer Partner's ("ETP's") Waha Gas Plant in Pecos County, Texas.  There is no physical address for the Barilla Draw Slug Catcher Facility.  The address of ETP's Waha Gas Plant is 2821 Waha Road, Coyanosa, TX 79730.  From Farm to Market Road ("FM") 1450, go 0.5 mile south on FM 1776, then 1 mile west on Waha Road to arrive at the main entrance to the Waha Gas Plant.  To reach the Barilla Draw Slug Catcher Facility, drive west past the main entrance to the Waha Gas Plant on Waha Road.  Take the first left onto the private lease road just west of the Waha Gas Plant. Go 0.5 miles south to the gate into the Barilla Draw Slug Catcher Facility.



The primary business of the Barilla Draw Slug Catcher Facility is bulk liquid storage and distribution of crude petroleum and petroleum products, including liquefied petroleum gas (NAICS 42471).  When the Centurion Pipeline L.P. (Occidental Petroleum Corporation) natural gas pipeline entering the Barilla Draw Slug Catcher Facility is being pigged to remove condensed liquid slugs, the equipment installed at the site is designed to safely separate and stabilize those liquids. A heated stabilizer column drives off remaining gas vapors ("light ends") from the pipeline liquids.  The present rated capacity of the Barilla Draw Slug Catcher Facility is 4,000 barrels (168,000 gallons) of stabilized condensate.



The facility has developed a risk management program to address the EPA RMP requirements (40 CFR Part 68).  Barilla Draw Slug Catcher Facility is diligent in the handling of all chemicals and is dedicated to the safety of its employees and the neighboring community.  The Barilla Draw Slug Catcher Facility staff is trained and utilizes equipment to monitor the facility and provide safeguards, while effectively and safely processing and storing the covered chemical, propane & butane. 



ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION POLICIES



Bari

lla Draw Slug Catcher Facility has a long standing commitment to worker and public safety. This commitment is demonstrated by the resources invested in accident prevention, such as personnel training and consideration of safety in the design, operation, and maintenance of the covered process.  Barilla Draw Slug Catcher Facility's policy is to implement reasonable controls to prevent foreseeable releases of regulated substances.



STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCE



Barilla Draw Slug Catcher Facility handles intermittent pipeline liquid slugs (heavier hydrocarbons that have condensed from the pressurized natural gas in a pipeline).  Thus, there are hazardous substances (flammable liquids) that are utilized in or generated by the process.

 

Based on the EPA definitions of flammable hydrocarbons, the quantities of the regulated flammable mixture in processing areas as well as in storage tanks at the facility consists of a total of approximately 785,000 lbs. of the flammable mixture.  The facility has designated this bulk liquid handling, storage & distribution activity as one Covered Process described below.

 

Bulk Petroleum Product Storage & Distribution (Stabilized Condensate/LPG)

The Barilla Draw Facility safely separates liquid slugs that enter the site from a buried natural gas pipeline.  The separated pipeline liquids are routed to a heated stabilizer column where any remaining gas vapors ("light ends") are driven off, compressed and returned to the pipeline.  The stabilized condensate (hydrocarbon liquids) are routed to horizontal bullet storage tanks.  The bulk liquids are loaded into tank trucks for transport to refineries/fractionation plants or blending terminals.  Personnel from the Operator, Kinder Morgan Treating, are present at all times during the day when truck loading operations are underway in the Barilla Draw Facility.



HAZARD ASSESSMENT SUMMARY/OFFSITE CONSEQUENCE ANALYSIS



Worst-Case Release Scenario Results Summary for Toxics

Not applicable for EPA RMP as there are no regulated toxic materials above the threshold at this facility.



Alternative Release Scenario Results Summary for Toxics

Not applicable for EPA RMP as there are no regulated toxic materials above the threshold at this facility.



Worst-Case Release Scenario Results Summary for Flammables

Scenario Description: After a preliminary evaluation of the flammable mixture at several locations, one worst-case release scenario was modeled which included a release of a single Stabilized Liquid Storage Tank (TK-1303/4/5/6/7/8/9) in the storage tank area.  The results can be found in the Hazard Assessment - Flammables documentation behind the Hazard Assessment Tab in the Submittal Binder located at the facility. 



Alternative Release Scenario Results Summary for Flammables

Scenario Description: One realistic alternative release scenario was modeled which considered a leak through a failed relief valve on a single Stabilized Liquid Storage Tank (TK-1303/4/5/6/7/8/9).  The results can be found in the Hazard Assessment - Flammables documentation located behind the Hazard Assessment Tab in the Submittal Binder located at the facility. 



Risk Considerations

Although bulk petroleum and petroleum product storage and distribution facilities (including those handling liquefied petroleum gases ["LPG"]) have inherent potential risks, and under a worst-case release scenario combustible vapors could potentially reach equipment in the adjacent manned ETP Waha Gas Plant, the Barilla Draw Slug Catcher Facility has recognized these potential risks and structured its safety programs and equipment spacing and layout to prevent and mitigate low probability-high consequence events, i.e., render the worst case incident as non-credible. 



In addition to the use of conservative analysis assumptions that over-predict the effects of a potential release, other characteristics of the facility and site serve to minimize the potential risks associated w

ith a flammable hydrocarbon release:

?The system has alarms and safety-related automation systems designed to shut down equipment and controls to minimize the potential for excursions outside normal parameters and acceptable operating limits.

?    The system undergoes periodic preventive maintenance and verification testing for critical safety devices to reduce the likelihood of catastrophic failures.



ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS



As part of the implementation of this Risk Management Program, key Prevention Program elements were implemented by Barilla Draw Slug Catcher Facility to manage process safety issues associated with the covered process.  In addition, common industry standards, policies, and procedures are currently utilized to ensure safe practices are being performed.

Barilla Draw Slug Catcher Facility's EPA RMP Prevention Program 3 elements for the flammable substance, propane/butane mixtures, include:

?Process Safety Information

?Process Hazard Analysis

?Operating Procedures

?Training

?Mechanical Integrity

?Management of Change

?Pre-Startup Safety Review

?Compliance Audits

?Incident Investigation

?Employee Participation

?How Work Permit

?Contractors

?Emergency Planning & Response

?Injury and Illness Prevention Program



FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY



Prior to the delivery date of this document, there have been no EPA RMP related accidents at the Barilla Draw Slug Catcher Facility in the past five (5) years as this is a new facility.  An incident investigation procedure is kept onsite which summarizes the required data to be reported, and will be utilized, as necessary to document any EPA RMP related incidents.



EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM 



Barilla Draw Slug Catcher Facility is committed to providing a safe and healthful work environment for its employees, the surrounding community and the environment.  The prevention of accidents, injuries, fires, emergency releases and other emergenc

y situations is of utmost importance and shall be the first priority for all persons working at the facility. 

Barilla Draw Slug Catcher Facility acts as a first responder.  Thus, Barilla Draw Slug Catcher Facility has an Emergency Response Plan in place and also submits appropriate documentation in regards to hazardous chemicals and associated quantities as to be included in the community emergency response plan.



PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY



The planned changes to improve safety at the Barilla Draw Slug Catcher Facility resolve the recommendations derived from the Process Hazard Analysis, as well as incorporate recommendations from Compliance Audits and Incident Investigations, as they become available.  The Barilla Draw Slug Catcher Facility has employed a tracking system for implementing these recommendations and ensuring their closure.  As required by the regulations, recommendations will be addressed and closed in a timely manner. 



EXTERNAL EVENTS ASSESSMENT



During the PHA for each system, a broad list of external events and human factors was considered by the Team.  General events external to the plant that can conceivably cause a release of stabilized or unstabilized condensate were evaluated.  The External Events that were considered credible include, but are not limited to, earthquake, tornado, vandalism, sabotage, external fire, human error/misoperation, and vehicle impact.
